comments.body: Does this need to be public?
Update the comment above to state that it is for testing this class only?

Added the availability of the service account as a condition for using the FlutterSkiaGoldFileComparator. There are some shards that meet the first three conditions, but are not meant for executing skia gold testing.
Do we ensure somewhere that _kFlutterRootKey is set in the environment? Does everybody working on Flutter and running these tests have to set this env variable now?
And should we fail more gracefully if the value is not set?
I think it is set when the tests are run. I'll find where, but also add a check here.
Why is this not taken from the instance variable `fs`?
It is a static method.
here (and elsewhere where these cross-links exists): the difference between the cooperators is not really made clear in these snippets.
Nice! Thanks for adding an overview of all the available comparators!

Is this ok to be null? If not assert and add it to the doc above.

May be good to mention this comment in the doc either way.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +83,87 @@  FlutterGoldenFileComparator(
    this.basedir,
    this.skiaClient, {
    this.fs = const LocalFileSystem(),
    this.platform = const LocalPlatform(),

comments.body: Does stuff in the base directory ever get cleaned up?

I do not think so.
For pre and post submit testing, the instance is fresh and clean each time. 
Locally, the test results/diffs are output there so I wouldn't want to dispose of them.

For local testing: Let's say I run the tests and it outputs a diff for two tests. I fix the diff for one and run the tests again. Wouldn't it be confusing that the second diff is still there for the test I fixed? It feels like we need to clean this up at some point?
nit: this could say a little more about what the basedir is used for.

Prior version called `isValidDigestForExpectation` here, to collect potential valid failures as the comparator searched for a positive. 
In this case, it may needlessly make this call multiple times before finding a positive.
Waiting to make this call until there is **no** positive found will save **a lot** of calls, as it will only reach this point when a change has been detected.
cirrusPR could also use the containsKey pattern?
This key can exist and be empty on Cirrus during post-submit checks, solely using `containsKey` would have a gap in covering the desired case.
Driveby comment: you may want to add to the documentation here explaining what suffix is and why it is needed.

Why aren't we just using `createTempSync` from package:file?

https://pub.dev/documentation/file/latest/file/Directory/createTempSync.html
When run locally, we want the files to be accessible to see diffs etc.
Ahh.  I'm a bit curious about whether we'd hit collisions at some point using math.random, but it's probably fine.

I thought so too, but then realized we only run 2-3 processes concurrently on ci, and only ~130/~4500 tests are golden file tests, so I feel like a collision would be incredibly rare in how this is written.
We could also check whether `platofrm.environment['GOLD_SERVICE_ACCOUNT'].startsWith('ENCRYPTED')`.  If so, we don't have a valid key.
